CatDescriptText: John A. Jones, retired, 2552 Breckenridge Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 13, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the hospital service rendered under Blue Cross plan is worth its present cost to the subscriber? Do you think the rates should be raised?  Why?"  answer reads: "I definitely do think that it is worth it.  I don't know about the proposed raise.  However, the last raise was all right in my estimation.  Blue Cross is a great help to families, especially when you are short on money."
